articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content: Past news

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in pamphlet on Feb. 1 by the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
 The work published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997) clarified the idea that it is a fundamental principle to be observed in carrying out the cause of socialism to preserve the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction, and tasks for embodying it and ways to do so.

articles.title: Pace-Setters in Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement to Meet
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in Various Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Seminars on leader  Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" was held by the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung  on Jan. 22 and by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism on Jan. 27 in the run-up to Feb. 16.
 Balzor Singh Chauhan, chairman of the Indian group, briefed the attendants of a seminar on the work, noting that the advantages and vitality of the Juche philosophy have been clearly proved by the work as the philosophy reflects the requirements of the revolutionary practice and gives the most correct answers to the questions arising in its course.    
 He said that Kim Jong Il set out the original Songun political mode based on the Juche idea on the basis of his deep insight into the changed reality and the need of the era.
 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, said that the Juche philosophy raised the issue of relationship between the world and man and his position and role in the world as a fundamental issue of philosophy and clarified the philosophical principle that man is the master of everything and decides everything and, on this basis, most correctly indicated the way of hewing out man's destiny. Herein lies the originality of the Juche philosophy that distinguishes it from the preceding philosophies of the working class, he added.
 Meanwhile, a seminar on Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was held at the Korean Chilbo Wood Company in Equatorial Guinea on Jan. 19.

articles.title: U.S. Test-fire of Interceptor Missile Disclosed
Iranian Embassy Officials Visit War Museum
articles.content:
U.S. Test-fire of Interceptor Missile Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an Internet broadcasting service in south  Korea, disclosed the fact that the Missile Defense Agency of the U.S. Department of Defense recently test-fired an interceptor missile targeted against the DPRK.
 The broadcasting service quoted the Jan. 25 issue of The Washington Times as saying so.    
 According to the paper, the U.S. conducted the test of intercepting a missile on Jan. 24 with many visitors including U.S. Congressmen and media persons watching it. But what mattered was that the U.S. chose a Pacific island as a missile launching site but the observers were unanimous in the view that the island was, in fact, supposed to be the DPRK.

articles.title: National Meeting Marks 60th Anniversary of UAWK
Bush's Reckless Remarks under Fire in S. Korea
Everybody Called upon to Advance Full of Great Ambition and Confidence
articles.content:
Bush's Reckless Remarks under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Reunification Solidarity for the Implementation of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and Peace on the Korean Peninsula reportedly made public a statement on Feb. 1 blasting U.S. President Bush's reckless remarks.
 The statement accused Bush of expressing his unchangeable bitterness toward the DPRK in his "state of the union address" on Jan. 31. This is little short of the U.S. formal declaration to the world that it has no intention to improve its relations with the north through dialogue, it noted.

articles.title: U.S. Military Actions for Preemptive Nuclear Attack Assailed
Appeal of DPRK Favored by Regional Organization
Trasylol-88 Developed
"GNP", Den of Swindles
India Donates Rice to DPRK
Russian Central Military Band Here
articles.content:
India Donates Rice to DPRK
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of conveying 2,000 tons of rice donated by the Indian government to the DPRK took place at Nampho Port on Feb. 7.
 Present there were Jo Si Bong, vice-minister of Food Procurement and Administration, officials concerned and N. T. Khankhup, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy.    
 The Indian government has donated to the DPRK various kinds of humanitarian aid materials including food and medicament on nine occasions since 1995.

articles.title: KCF Delegation Leaves for Brazil
articles.content:
Russian Central Military Band Here
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The central military band of the Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation headed by Valerii Khalilov, chief of the Military Orchestral Service and its chief conductor of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, arrived here today.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao President
articles.content:
KCF Delegation Leaves for Brazil
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Christian Federation headed by Chairman Kang Yong Sop left here today for Brazil.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao President
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Lao President Khamtay Siphandone on his 82nd birthday. 
 The message sincerely wished the president good health and happiness as well as greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity and progress of the country. 
 It also expressed the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in line with the desire and interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Indonesian President Leaves
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Egyptian President
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of sympathy to Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak on Sunday.
 Upon hearing the sad news of the recent sinking of an Egyptian liner in the Red Sea that claimed big casualties, I express profound sympathy and consolation to you and, through you, to the bereaved families and the victims, the message said.

articles.title: South Korean Delegation Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Indonesian President Leaves
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is a political counselor to the president, and his party left here Tuesday after wrapping up their four-day visit to the DPRK.
 While staying in Korea, they visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay respects to President Kim Il Sung, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Grand People's Study House, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Taean Friendship Glass Factory and other places.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Finnish President
articles.content:
South Korean Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the south Korean "Institute for Policy Studies" led by Director Rim Chae Jong arrived here on Feb. 7.
 It was greeted at the airport by Ri Jong Hyok, director of the National Reunification Institute, and officials concerned.
